title: Macron denounces US competition seeking to 'subordinate Europe'
subhead: In a speech at the World Economic Forum in Davos, French President Emmanuel Macron also decried an 'endless accumulation of new tariffs that are fundamentally unacceptable.'

title: Trump's 'board of peace' fails to spark enthusiasm among world leaders
EU chief vows 'unflinching' response to Trump's Greenland ambitions
Rights groups report widespread sexual violence against Palestinians in Israeli prisons
subhead: One-third of the 21 detainees who spoke to the Israeli NGO B'Tselem after their release said they had been subjected to violence, including forced undressing, blows to the genitals, and anal penetration. Other NGOs and UN agencies have reported similar accounts. Israel has denied any systematic mistreatment.

title: 'Article 49.3': How France's government can pass a budget without a vote
subhead: With Parliament deadlocked, the French prime minister is set to invoke a constitutional tool to ram the budget bill through. In response, will face two votes of no-confidence.

title: In 'Hamnet,' love is haunted by the specter of death
subhead: Chloé Zhao's film, marked by its raw and singular poetry, follows the formation of William Shakespeare's household, capturing both its joys and tragedies.

title: In one year, Trump has imposed a culture of impunity
subhead: Since returning to the White House, the American president has exempted himself from all rules, both domestically and internationally. This sense of impunity now permeates his entire administration.

subhead: The president's threats could undermine the agreement reached by the United States and the European Union in the summer of 2025.

title: 'Why War?': How thinkers answer this heartbreaking question
subhead: Since the bloodbath of World War I, philosophers have repeatedly grappled with the question: Is war an irrepressible human urge, or the product of historical and social forces?

title: The strange airborne rescue of Gaza's donkeys, from Israel to Europe
subhead: Since 2022, Sharon Cohen, who runs an animal rescue group near Tel Aviv, has removed donkeys from Palestinian owners she accuses of mistreatment and sent them to shelters across Europe. The initiative has drawn outrage amid Gaza's deepening humanitarian crisis.
